decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to consistently deal direct damage to the opponent through a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently utilizing cheap spells and creatures like Fiery Temper, Lava Dart, and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to quickly whittle down the opponent's life total. Additionally, cards like Faithless Looting allow for card filtering and dig for more burn spells, while Fireblast provides a powerful finisher. The strategy is to establish early pressure and maintain momentum to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent while constantly dealing damage through burn spells and creature abilities. With a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, along with creatures like Guttersnipe and Voldaren Epicure, the goal is to quickly diminish the opponent's life total. By maintaining a fast and relentless pace, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a strong defense.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, as well as aggressive creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Voldaren Epicure. This aggressive playstyle is supported by cards like Guttersnipe and Sneaky Snacker that deal damage whenever spells are cast. The deck also utilizes cards like Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery to generate card advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a low mana curve and a focus on burn spells, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying small, efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive attackers. By utilizing cards like Thraben Inspector and Kor Skyfisher, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of creatures on the battlefield while also protecting them with cards like Prismatic Strands. Battle Screech and Guardians' Pledge provide additional ways to flood the board with creatures, while Journey to Nowhere offers removal against opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to build a fast, resilient board presence to quickly close out the game against the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells and removal spells. It also aims to draw cards and generate value through efficient creatures like Squadron Hawk and Sacred Cat. The deck takes advantage of gate lands to fix mana and ensure consistent access to all colors, while also utilizing cards like Prismatic Strands to protect against aggro strategies. With a mix of defensive creatures and powerful spells, this deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out wins through attrition.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and sacrificing them to deal damage, drawing cards, and controlling the opponent's resources. It includes a mix of cheap artifacts to sacrifice, efficient removal spells, and creatures with affinity for artifacts. By sacrificing artifacts with Makeshift Munitions or Nihil Spellbomb, the player can control the board and deal with threats while drawing cards using Ichor Wellspring and Thoughtcast. The deck aims to be aggressive and overwhelming, using artifacts and spells to maintain board presence and chip away at the opponent's life total.

This deck focuses on using sacrifice and removal spells to control the board while also generating card advantage and recurring threats. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by utilizing synergies between sacrificing artifacts and creatures, recurring them from the graveyard, and disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. The deck aims to maintain a tight grip on the board while steadily accumulating advantages, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cycling creatures, graveyard recursion spells, and mana acceleration to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then bring them back with Reaping the Graves for a powerful combo finish. The deck aims to quickly cycle through its cards, generating mana with Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, while also controlling the board with Drannith Healer and Drannith Stinger. The key strategy is to maximize the value of Songs of the Damned and Lotus Petal to cast multiple spells in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with big creatures like Horror of the Broken Lands and Imposing Vantasaur.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast. The deck also includes artifact synergies with Melded Moxite and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt opponents. Additional lifegain from cards like Kabira Crossroads and Radiant Fountain help sustain the aggro strategy. The deck aims to apply pressure early and efficiently, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal and artifact hate.

This deck focuses on using cheap control spells and card draw to outvalue the opponent. By using cards like Ephemerate and Snap to protect key creatures like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage over time. God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Sunscape Familiar help to gain life and reduce the cost of spells, allowing the player to cast multiple spells per turn. The goal is to control the board and grind out a win through efficient card advantage and tempo plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By sacrificing artifacts for damage or card draw, the deck can maintain a steady stream of threats and resources to stay ahead. With a mix of removal and card advantage, it aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up its own army of artifact creatures. The synergy between cards like Myr Enforcer, Galvanic Blast, and Thoughtcast allows for explosive turns and powerful tempo swings.

The main idea of this deck is to flood the board with various Elf creatures and use mana acceleration to play more spells each turn, overwhelming the opponent with sheer numbers and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through cards like Priest of Titania and utilizing the mana to play powerful creatures like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way provide card draw to keep the elf engine going, while cards like Avenging Hunter and Masked Vandal offer removal and disruption options.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Sneaky Snacker, Guttersnipe, and Highway Robbery, along with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the goal is to pressure the opponent's life total as quickly as possible. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature and burn damage, ultimately leading to a fast victory. With a focus on efficient aggression and direct damage, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence with inexpensive, aggressive creatures, backed up by various enchantments that enhance their abilities and provide protection. By buffing up the small creatures with auras like Ethereal Armor and Benevolent Blessing, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacks. The inclusion of spells like Emerge Unscathed and Spirit Link also helps to keep your creatures alive and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly play low-cost aggressive creatures to deal damage to the opponent early in the game while using countermagic to protect them. The deck includes cards that can draw additional cards to keep up the pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Overall, the goal is to win the game through efficient use of resources and carefully timing attacks and defenses.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, high-powered creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cheap spells to fill the graveyard and reduce the cost of cards like Cryptic Serpent, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and control the game with counterspells and tempo plays. The emphasis is on efficiency and speed, pushing for a quick victory through aggressive plays and smart decision-making.
